question: The primary function of the bias circuit is to
a: hold the circuit stable at VCC
b: hold the circuit stable at vin
d: hold the circuit stable at the designed Q-point
answer: hold the circuit stable at the designed Q-point

question: A JFET
The capacitor that produces an ac ground is called a(n)
In a class B push-pull amplifier, the transistors are biased slightly above cutoff to avoid
The depletion-mode MOSFET
a: can operate with only positive gate voltages
b: can operate with only negative gate voltages
c: cannot operate in the ohmic region
d: can operate with positive as well as negative gate voltages
answer: can operate with positive as well as negative gate voltages

question: Three different points are shown on a dc load line. The upper point represents the
Which of the following conditions are needed to properly bias an npn transistor amplifier?
a: Forward bias the base/emitter junction and reverse bias the base/collector junction.
b: Forward bias the collector/base junction and reverse bias the emitter/base junction.
c: Apply a positive voltage on the n-type material and a negative voltage on the p-type material.
d: Apply a large voltage on the base.
answer: Forward bias the base/emitter junction and reverse bias the base/collector junction.

question: Often a common-collector will be the last stage before the load; the main function of this stage is to
b: buffer the voltage amplifiers from the low-resistance load
d: provide a high-frequency path to improve the frequency response
answer: buffer the voltage amplifiers from the low-resistance load

If the drain, source, and channel of a MOSFET are all a p-type material, and it operates in both modes, this is an n-channel D-MOSFET.
A practical CE amplifier has the input on the base and the output taken off the emitter.

Base currents are usually small because of the physical construction of the thin and lightly doped base.
The beta of a BJT is the ratio of collector current to emitter current.

An essential requirement of a feedback oscillator is a phase shift around the feedback loop of 360°.
The gate-source junction of a JFET must be ________ for proper linear operation.
The ___ oscillator takes advantage of the piezoelectric effect.
In order to sustain oscillations in a feedback oscillator, the gain should be _________ so the product of Av × B equals_______.
Vce approximately equals _______ when a transistor is in saturation.
The power gain (Ap) of any transistor amplifier circuit equals the ___________.
b: current gain times the voltage gain
c: voltage gain times the output resistance
d: current gain plus the voltage gain
answer: current gain times the voltage gain

question: A(n) ___ has a conductive channel only when it is biased properly.
The collector current in a class A amplifier flows for ________ of the ac input signal.
Removing a bypass capacitor from a common-emitter amplifier circuit will _________ voltage gain and ________ input resistance.
